JobFullDesc: We are seeking a talented and highly motivated attorney to lead Facebook’s global affiliate team. The Associate General Counsel, Global Corporate would manage a growing team of corporate legal professionals based in the U.S., EMEA and APAC. The role requires the ability to lead a rapidly scaling function and partner effectively with large multi-stakeholder teams. We require an individual who is proactive, flexible, collaborative, diligent, and has demonstrated excellent legal and business judgment, strategic thinking, with solid leadership and communication skills.  This is a full-time position based in our Dublin office or remotely within time zone proximity.Working under the supervision of Facebook’s Director, Associate General Counsel, Head of M&A and Global Corporate, the  Associate General Counsel, Global Corporate will lead a team responsible for supporting Facebook’s affiliate companies with respect to a broad range of legal, governance, compliance and administrative matters across the U.S., LATAM, EMEA and APAC. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record managing a similar function at a large multinational corporation with demonstrated expertise in corporate governance matters including affiliate board management and secretarial duties, maintenance of corporate records, global statutory financial compliance, corporate policy implementation, and supporting complex transactions.Manage, support and scale a growing team of legal professionals who support Facebook’s global corporate affiliate affairs.Partner closely with finance and accounting leaders to ensure compliance with multi-jurisdictional statutory filing requirements.Oversee corporate secretarial duties for Facebook’s primary international corporate hubs, including confidently advising local boards of directors and implementing governance best practices.Manage relationships with key external lawyers and service providers.Develop and scale technological solutions, including internal and third-party tooling, to enable an efficient and highly responsive client service function.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSJ.D. degree (or foreign equivalent).10+ years of legal experience, including at a law firm and substantial in-house experience.Experience managing a corporate secretarial function, including advising on corporate governance matters, and partnering with finance and accounting professionals to manage a global statutory compliance function.Outstanding business judgment and client counseling experience.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSJ.D. degree (or foreign equivalent).10+ years of legal experience, including at a law firm and substantial in-house experience.Experience managing a corporate secretarial function, including advising on corporate governance matters, and partnering with finance and accounting professionals to manage a global statutory compliance function.Outstanding business judgment and client counseling experience.Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
